document.short_description:
Bandra Born, which started off as a twelve-week pop-up by chef-partner Gresham Fernandes, is now a restaurant and bar. Gresham and his Head Chef, Manoj Shetty, are serving straight-up Bandra flavors through his lens. Each plate and sip is a snapshot of the ever-evolving hood with influences from his experiences through travels and his childhood. Inspired by everything in the neighborhood, hip-hop culture, bakeries, places, people, his childhood, travels, and work experience, which influence him and his cooking style. The menu is a celebration of everything that is Gresham Fernandes. He brings his skills, knowledge, and passion.


Vegetarian Menu


Touchings        

Burrata - grapes, tomatoes, parsley oil

Sour Dough - Yeasted Miso Butter 

    

Dining Room     

                             

Beets Meats  

beet textures, cultured cream


Roasted Onion Tart  

Stewed onions till they are sweet, onion tears,


Jackfruit Curry Dip

cooked down with an EastIndian coconut and bottle masala served with a croissant pav


Charred Carrots, Smoked Aubergine, Carrot Glaze 

Roasted over coal, grazed with their juice


Overnight Roasted Cabbage, Brown Butter, Cabbage Salt

says it all 


Mushroom Congee, Crispy Things

an umami tsunami in a bowl

 

Desserts


Jam Cake

jam sorbet whipped caramel 


Chocolate 

Chef says it's WIP  

 

Not Vegetarian


Touchings

Burrata- grapes, tomatoes, parsley oil

Sour Dough - Xo Butter 

 

Dining Room    

                                      

Beets Meats

beet textures, cultured cream


Roasted Onion Tart 

stewed onions till they are sweet, onion tears,


East Indian Crab Curry 

steamed crab cooked down with an eastindian coconut and bottle masala served with a croissant pav


Pork Belly With Charred Leaves, Carrot Glaze

crisp skin & ginger jam


Grilled Tenderloin, Marrow Miso Jam, Chilly Oil 

says it all 


Duck Congee, Crispy Things

an umami tsunami in a bowl

 

Desserts


Jam Cake

jam sorbet, whipped caramel 


Chocolate 

Chef says it's WIP


________

document.short_description:
The Ramen Bar - A 1 day Pop-Up by Chef Mako feat. A Sake Bar


Prepare your palate for an epicurean Japanese journey like never before! We're thrilled to announce the arrival of 'The Ramen Bar' at Love, Ooru on May 4th, Saturday! Join us atop our rooftop oasis for an evening curated by the culinary genius, Chef Mako: who brings his years of experience in Japanese Cuisine to your table. From soul-warming bowls of ramen to perfectly pan-seared gyoza and an array of other Japanese delights on the menu, every bite is a celebration of flavor and tradition. And to elevate your experience, we’ll have a selection of premium sakes and soju to order from The Sake bar menu.


Love,

OORU

(Formerly Om Made Cafe)


• Limited seats available. Reservations recommended. 

• ₹1000/ person cover charge to reserve (non-refundable). 

• No outside Food / Alcohol allowed

• Enquire: 9886515954/ 9886895136



ABOUT CHEF MAKO:

With roots from Japan, a Chef & Restaurant Developer by profession, Chef Mako's culinary journey is extraordinary. An alumnus of Lycée Hôtelier Saint-Louis, France, he went on to set up the acclaimed restaurants Harima, 10 Speakeasy, 1Q1 and many more. Chef Mako’s most recent venture was co-founding Chef’s-a-Porter: a platform connecting renowned Chefs and curious Diners. He has truly made his mark in the Bangalore culinary scene.

default_section.label: What's included
default_section.text: A Rs.  1000/ person cover charge taken at the time of reservation is redeemable on both food & Wines / Sakes

document.name: 'Up' Movie Screening | Family Movie Night
document.short_description:
Family Movie Night: World Cinema for Kids!


Join us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this film while cozying up with your family!


*In response to the current heatwave taking place in Bangalore, this movie screening will take place in our studio space on the first floor of our venue. Your comfort and enjoyment are our top priorities!


"Up" is a heartwarming animated adventure film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released in 2009. The movie follows the story of Carl Fredricksen, a widowed elderly man, who fulfills his lifelong dream of visiting South America by tying thousands of balloons to his house and flying it there. However, he soon discovers that a young Wilderness Explorer named Russell has inadvertently become a stowaway. Together, they embark on a journey filled with unexpected adventures, encountering a colorful cast of characters including talking dogs and an eccentric explorer named Charles Muntz. Along the way, Carl learns valuable lessons about love, friendship, and the importance of adventure. "Up" is celebrated for its emotional depth, stunning animation, and memorable characters, and it received widespread critical acclaim, winning two Academy Awards and earning a place in the hearts of audiences of all ages.


Event Highlights

Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children.

Cultivate Cultural Curiosity: Spark interest in world cinema and inspire exploration of different cultures through the enchantment of film.

Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.


Why Attend?

Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling.

Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity.

Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.


Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema.

Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!


Terms and Conditions:


  1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.
  2. No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.
  3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.
  4. Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.
  5. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.
  6. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.
  7. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.
  8. In case of rain or other unforeseen conditions, the event will be moved indoors.

document.short_description:
Chef's Corner at 2 Moons featuring Chef Taiyaba


Chef Taiyaba unveils the secrets of Lucknowi cuisine during our Hands-on Lucknowi Cuisine Experience. Join us for an unforgettable afternoon of culinary delights and cultural immersion.


📅 Date: May 18th  

🕛 Time: 12pm - 3pm  


In association with Campo Viejo, we're thrilled to enhance your experience with an exclusive Wine Tasting and Pairing session. Savor the finest wines expertly paired with each dish, curated to elevate your taste buds and enrich your senses.



🍽️ Menu Highlights:


Tawa Kawabs:

  • Galawat ke Kawab (Mutton)
  • Bhuni Kaleji (Liver)

Deep Fry:

  • Chapli Kabab (Chicken)

Grill:

  • Til ke Prawns/ Anardana Jhinga
  • Bihari Kawab
  • Amritsari Fish Tikka

Accompaniments:

  • Chutney
  • Salad
  • Breads


🍷 Tasting and Pairing with -

- Campo Viejo Tempranillo 

- Campo Viejo Blanco


Terms and Conditions -

  • Ticket sales are final and non-refundable, available online only through designated platforms.
  • Entry is granted with a valid ticket; attendees must be 18 or older for wine tasting.
  • Prompt arrival is recommended as the event starts on time; latecomers may miss segments.
  • No shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means. Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.
  • Alcoholic beverages are served only to legal drinkers.
  • Attendees consent to being photographed or recorded for promotional purposes.
  • Unforeseen circumstances may lead to event postponement, rescheduling, or cancellation, with efforts made for ticket transfers.

document.short_description:
Sandwich Shop the Conservatory!

Indulge in a two-day ‘Sandwich Shop’ at the Conservatory showcasing the culinary mastery of Chef Christopher Fernandes and Delzad. Come, grab, eat & go!


MENU FOR THE SANDWICH SHOP 


1.⁠ ⁠Monte Cristo (₹845)

Smoked homemade ham, aged cheddar, egg dipped (slice white loaf) 


2.⁠ ⁠Brisket Grill Cheese (₹1040)

18hrs smoked Brisket grilled cheese, brioche loaf, honey mustard, caramelised onions, smoked scaromza, pickles, and bonemarrow butter.


3.⁠ ⁠Spicy Chicken Donut (₹845)

Grilled Chicken s/w ( honey chipotle grilled chicken leg, smoked cream cheese, donut, truffle honey) -


4.⁠ ⁠Mojo Pork Sandwich (₹845)

pulled mojo pork, potato bun, smoked buffalo-style hot sauce, pickles 


5.⁠ ⁠Umame Mushroom (₹715)

Wild mix mushrooms, shitake miso, mozzarella 


6.⁠ ⁠Burrata Baguette (₹682)

Roast eggplant, smoked pepper tapenade, baby Burrata, Balsamic glaze, rocket

account_data.company_description: Immerse yourself in an era gone by...

document.booking_confirmation_message:
Hi there!


We are so excited to take you on an exciting journey, travelling back in time, visiting an era gone by!


Here is the link to our location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/cPznXQ7hgfugF5sf8?g_st=iw


We will need a minimum of 15 individuals to conduct the tour. Incase there is a cancellation due to the numbers, we will let you know 48 hours before the day of the event.


A few things to keep in mind. As most of these vehicles are over a 100 years old and extremely delicate, we do not allow for guests to sit inside, however you are most welcome to take photographs.

As the tour involves a lot of walking through an estate surrounded by a beautiful canopy of trees, please wear comfortable shoes.


We can't wait to share our portal into the past with you!


See you soon!


Warmly,

Rupali

document.name: Slow Tide at The Conservatory
document.short_description:
Slow Tide at The Conservatory

Interpreting the Indian coastline in 5 plates


Slow Tide, once a small fishing enclave, geographically, and socially, withdrawn from mainstreams of otherworldliness. Discovered and embraced by a global gathering, bringing about the ‘Anjuna Commune’. Free spirits, making their way across exotic Asia on an adventure-filled land route, seeking the unconventional. Growing up here, ‘Anjunkars’ understand that it’s okay to live a life others don’t understand. 

Founded by Neil Dsouza, a Goan living in Bombay who moved back to Goa during the pandemic. Slow Tide, conceived during the pandemic redefines the Anjuna Shack. The successful revival of Anjuna's hippie culture by award-winning Architect Palinda Kannangara is reflected in the space, which changes "Fable" to "Table." Born in Rajagiriya, Sri Lanka, Palinda’s contextual sensitivity and experimental use of material carried our story forward. Inspired by frequent stays with us over the years, the site has become a generator of all ideas, designs never frozen but continuing to evolve. 


Vegetarian Menu

Pineapple & Grapes Sasam

Chilli-Lime Rubbed Pineapple & Grapes Sasam Salad with Curried Cashew Sauce & Caramel Rice Puff


Brussels Sprouts & Pumpkin Thoran Tostada

Brussels Sprouts & Pumpkin Thoran with Fermented Bean Pure & Poppy Seeds Crumble


Chiapas Grilled New Corn

Charred New Corn with Borracha New Cron with Goat cheese, Pickled lime Salsa & Puffed Jowar


Wild Mushroom Caldine Momos

Wild Mushroom Momos with Caldine Curry, Radish-Peanut Oistou & Lime Oil


Puran-Coconut Pataleo

Gram & Coconut Pataleo with Jaggery caramel Sauce & Almond Granola


Non- Vegetarian Menu

Red Snapper Crudo

Red Snapper Ceviche with Chilli-Tamarind Sauce & Seaweed Rice Crisp


Back Waters Carab Cake

Green Pepper & Betel Leaf Spiced Crab Cake with Cilantro-Green Apple Chutney & Recheado Aioli


Ceylon Pork Curry Taco

Sri lankan Blackened Spiced Pork Belly Curry & Pol Roti With Sambol


Mutton Alooni Bhaat

Goan Mutton (Meat & Bone) Stew with Indrayani Rice Khichadi & Muttton Pickle


Puran-Coconut Pataleo

Gram & Coconut Pataleo with Jaggery caramel Sauce & Almond Granola
